title: Training error (bash run.sh): libprotobuf FATAL google/protobuf/stubs/common.cc:61
body:
Hello all,
I met a libprotobuf version problem, when I tried to train network by comment "bash run.sh". It gave the error message:
[libprotobuf FATAL google/protobuf/stubs/common.cc:61] This program requires version 3.9.0 of the Protocol Buffer runtime library, but the installed version is 2.6.1.  Please update your library.  If you compiled the program yourself, make sure that your headers are from the same version of Protocol Buffers as your link-time library.  (Version verification failed in "google/protobuf/descriptor.pb.cc".)
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'google::protobuf::FatalException'
  what():  This program requires version 3.9.0 of the Protocol Buffer runtime library, but the installed version is 2.6.1.  Please update your library.  If you compiled the program yourself, make sure that your headers are from the same version of Protocol Buffers as your link-time library.  (Version verification failed in "google/protobuf/descriptor.pb.cc".)

I think it should be the Protocol Buffers version conflict problem of System (2.6.1) and Anaconda (3.9.0). I tried to solve this problem but failed. Any one can give the detailed instruction about how to solve it. Thanks in advance! @foolwood
